title: John Bercow set for another clash with Government when he rules whether MPs can vote again on Boris Johnson's deal
text:
John Bercow is set for another clash with the Government over Brexit on Monday when he will rule on whether MPs can vote again to approve Boris Johnson's deal.

The Government decided to boycott Saturday's Meaningful Vote on the terms of the UK's exit from the EU after Mr Johnson's erstwhile allies in the DUP joined the other opposition parties in voting for the Letwin amendment.

Jacob Rees-Mogg, the Leader of the House of Commons, then surprised the Speaker and Opposition MPs by announcing that the Government would put the deal to a Meaningful Vote on Monday in a second attempt to force it through the Commons.
